definition: toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
to drill/to bore/to get into/to make one's way into/to enter (a hole)/to thread one's way through/to study intensively/to dig into/to curry favor for personal gain
variant of 鑽|钻[zuan4]
an auger/diamond
camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for

sentences.english: Look for no profit out of it, see no future in it, just the present.
sentences.chinese: 不要钻营于利益之中，没有未来的考量，只有现在。

sentences.english: He bribed himself onto the committee.
sentences.chinese: 他暗通关节，钻营投机挤进了委员会。

sentences.english: China's development will not bring harm or pose a threat to anyone.
sentences.chinese: 中国钻营发展既不破损他人，更不恐吓他人。

sentences.english: We hate our peers because they always seem to get ahead of us.
sentences.chinese: 我们痛恨同业，因为他们永远比我们会钻营。

definition: to smooth whiskers and pat a horse's bottom (idiom); to use flatter to get what one wants/to toady/boot-licking
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
to cling to the powerful and rich (idiom); social climbing
to fawn on/to ingratiate oneself/(literary) to meet face to face
to resort to bragging and flattering
flattering and fawning (idiom)/sweet-talking
lit. see the wind and set the helm (idiom); fig. to act pragmatically/to be flexible and take advantage of the situation
to bow down to everything sb says or does/to act submissively in order to ingratiate oneself
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
see 扳龍附鳳|扳龙附凤[ban1 long2 fu4 feng4]
to angle for fame (idiom)/to fish for compliments
to fight for fame, grab profit (idiom); scrambling for fame and wealth/only interested in personal gain
see 走門路|走门路[zou3 men2 lu4]
to fawn on/to kiss up to
to seek contact with sb for one's own benefit/to suck up to sb
to flatter/to toady
